member.name: T:TS.Testing.ContainsStateExtensions
member.summary: Extension methods used by the .

member.name: M:TS.Testing.ContainsStateExtensions.ContainsState(System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Determines if the actual object contains the state of the expected object.
member.param: The object whose state is being examined.
The state to confirm within the object. This parameter can be any object; however, a useful application is to use an anonymous type.
member.remarks: This method is useful for state-based unit tests where you need to assert the state of objects with complext structures.

member.name: T:TS.Testing.ComponentTestBase`1
member.summary: A for test classes that need to test a component, which is a class that uses constructor-based dependency injection.
member.typeparam: The type of the component being tested by the concrete test class.

member.name: M:TS.Testing.ComponentTestBase`1.GetDependencies
member.summary: Gets the set of dependency values (in the correct order) that get injected into the component's constructor during the method.

member.name: M:TS.Testing.ComponentTestBase`1.CreateTarget
member.summary: Allows tests to create instances of the component with all of its injected dependencies.

member.name: M:TS.Testing.ComponentTestBase`1.GetDependencyParameters
member.summary: Allow subclasses to get access to the dependency parameters passed into the constructor.
member.returns: An dictionary containing all dependency instances by name.

member.name: T:TS.Testing.DependencyContainerTestBase`1
member.summary: A for test classes that need to test a component that is a dependency container, which is a simple class that exposes all the parameters to its constructor via properties of the same name.
member.typeparam: The type of the dependency container being tested by the concrete test class.
